movies.name: 1) Lion King
movies.description: It’s the third-highest grossing animated film in history.

movies.name: 2) Mermaid
movies.description: The film won two Academy Awards for Best Original Score and Best Original Song (Under the Sea).

movies.name: 3) Hercules
movies.description: Hercules earned $252.7 million in Box Office revenue worldwide

movies.name: 4) Shrek
movies.description: After opening at No. 1 at the domestic box office, it went on to earn nearly $500 million worldwide on a production budget of $60 million. “Shrek” was widely praised by critics and went on to win the first Academy Award for best animated feature, beating out, among others, Pixar's “Monsters, Inc.

movies.name: 5) Cars
movies.description: Won both the Annie Award for Best Animated Feature and the Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film

movies.name: 6) Toy Story
movies.description: The film was critically and financially successful, grossing over $373 million worldwide

movies.name: 7) Beauty and the beast
movies.description: Beauty and the Beast has officially crossed the $1 billion mark at the box office. The live-action film, starring Emma Watson, is now this year's highest grossing film worldwide

movies.name: 8) Monsters inc
movies.description: Monsters, Inc. received critical acclaim and was a commercial success, grossing over $577 million worldwide to become the third highest-grossing film of 2001

movies.name: 9) Sleeping Beauty
movies.description: During its original release in January 1959, Sleeping Beauty grossed approximately $5.3 million in theater rentals (the distributor's share of the box office gross) from the United States and Canada.

movies.name: 10) Mulan
movies.description: It grossed over $304 million. It earned a Golden Globe and Academy Award nomination and won several Annie Awards, including Best Animated Feature.
